image.altText: Cruz Pamoana Davis-Tuka with face blurred and handcuffs being arrested by NSW Police walking through yard

items.synopsis: The court heard Cruz Pamoana Davis-Tuka claimed his "friend" Johnson Kokozian was a passenger, not the driver, of a car involved in a crash that killed two siblings.

title.children: Man accused of lying to protect friend over deadly Sydney crash 'left the scene', court told

image.altText: William Tyrrell's former foster parents, with faces blurred, are seen during a break at the Parramatta Local Court

items.synopsis: The couple, who cannot be identified for legal reasons, has faced a week-long hearing in Parramatta Local Court, where covert recordings of their home and car were played.

title.children: William Tyrrell's former foster parents considered 'capable and competent' by department, court told

image.altText: A sign reading 'Dubbo Hospital' in between two trees

items.synopsis: NSW Police and NSW Health are investigating the death of a four-year-old boy this week at Dubbo Base Hospital. The boy's death has been referred to the coroner.

title.children: Death of a 4yo boy in out-of-home care at NSW hospital sparks police investigation, clinical review

image.altText: Fish floating in water

items.synopsis: Irrigators and nature conservationists are urging the NSW government to implement recommendations made by the Office of the Chief Scientist and Engineer to mitigate future fish kill events in Menindee.

title.children: Menindee fish kill findings prompts calls for NSW government to act, and act fast

image.altText: new south wales police as part of taskforce magnus arrest a man who is sitting down on the ground with handcuffs

items.synopsis: Nine people, including two women, were arrested overnight over a range of gun and drug offences, with prohibited items and cash seized, following an operation by Taskforce Magnus.

title.children: Organised crime blitz across Sydney prevents 'two, perhaps three' murders in past five weeks

image.altText: Payne wearing a red jacket and dark-rimmed glasses looks across frame.

items.synopsis: One of the Liberal Party's most senior women, and the first woman to hold the defence portfolio in Australia, will retire from politics after 26 years in parliament.

title.children: 'A grand contribution': Former minister and Liberal stalwart Marise Payne to quit politics

image.altText: A man with short dark hair pictured with his daughter whose face is pixellated

items.synopsis: The tight-knit WA community of Kellerberrin faces a long road to recovery after a father was shot dead by another well-known local resident, sparking a manhunt and police stand-off that forced the town into lockdown.

title.children: Father Terry Czernowski officially identified as victim of WA workplace fatal shooting

image.altText: A man with a jacket over his head

items.synopsis: Christopher Borg pleaded guilty to two counts of common assault and failed to have the charges dismissed on the grounds of mental health issues.

title.children: Ex-NSW police officer has sentence cut for 'entirely unprovoked' kicking of Indigenous teen

image.altText: A selfie of a serious man with shaved hair next to his large brown dog.

items.synopsis: Surfer Tony Begg is lucky to be alive after being attacked by a shark on a NSW beach. The off-duty doctor who saved him says he is a "fighter".

title.children: It's 'absolutely crazy' he survived, says responding off-duty doctor after shark attack

image.altText: The Google logo at the company's headquarters. The logo is the company name with blue, red, yellow, blue, green and red letters.

items.synopsis: A new code drafted by the industry giants at the government's request will require search engines to ensure deepfakes of child abuse material are not returned in search results.

title.children: New code to ensure AI-generated child abuse material is removed from search results

image.altText: A health worker wears blue latex gloves and draws some coronavirus vaccine from a vial with a syringe.

items.synopsis: Here's a quick wrap of the COVID-19 news and case numbers from each Australian jurisdiction from the past week.

title.children: All the latest COVID-19 case numbers from around Australia

image.altText: Vivienne Mitchell's face and upper body is superimposed over a picture of razors that has a price tag of $43

items.synopsis: Backlash against Coles and Woolworths is swirling on social media as the supermarket giants record large profits amid a cost of living crisis. But one expert says the anger, and calls for a boycott, are unlikely to have a lasting effect.

title.children: How one Australian's 'sheer disbelief' at the rising cost of groceries reached 1.7 million shoppers

image.altText: A row of huts that have curved roofs and exterior walls

items.synopsis: A group of heritage-listed huts will not be moved to make way for a new rugby league high performance centre after outcry from community groups.

title.children: 'Iconic symbol' of post-WWII migration not budging for new $50 million NRL team hub

image.altText: People cross the road at an intersection in a busy CBD.

items.synopsis: The corporate regulator is suing Australia's largest superannuation fund for allegedly failing to address multiple superannuation accounts belonging to 90,000 customers, while the ASX is lower after a flat start. Follow live.

title.children: ASIC sues AustralianSuper over 'failure' that took $69m from the accounts of 90,000 members, ASX down

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Here's how things are standing at 4.20pm AEST : ASX 200 : -0.2% at 7,156 points (market close) All Ords: -0.2% at 7,358 points (market close) Australian dollar: +0.2% at 64.07 US cents Nikkei225: -1.2% to 32,606 points FTSE : +0.2% to 7,44 points Dow Jones: +0.2% to 34,500 points S & P 500: -0.3% to 4,451 points Spot gold: +0.5% at $US1,926.79/ounce Brent crude: -0.5% at $US89.62/barrel Bitcoin: +1% at $US26,223
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Market update: ASX closes with another loss

children.content: Here's how things are standing at

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: After losing more ground today, the ASX200 has shed 1.67% in value this week, to close down 121.6 points, to 7,152.4 points. Here's what the last five days of trading looks like:
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Australia's market loses 1.67% for the week

children.content: After losing more ground today, the ASX200 has shed 1.67% in value this week, to close down 121.6 points, to 7,152.4 points.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Alright! Trading's finished for the day, but as we wait for trades to settle here's what's happening tonight. On Close of Business, in the age of global decarbonisation, Rachel Pupazzoni speaks to specialist energy economist from Victoria University Bruce Mountain, about whether Australia can be a renewable energy super power. With Snowy Hydro 2.0 facing a massive cost blow out and the New South Wales government in talks with Origin Energy to delay the closure of the coal fired Eraring power plant, Dr Mountain says " Australia has the ingredients to be a low cost energy producer, but government policy has not allowed the best transition to renewables so far". Also on the program, a look back on the week that saw Qantas boss Alan Joyce step down early, and the Reserve Bank governor Philip Lowe concede the bank went too far with its support of the economy through the lockdowns in 2020 and 2021. You can watch the program tonight on the ABC News Channel at 9:30pm AEST or as it repeats on Saturday and Sunday, or you can catch it any time on ABC iView .
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Close of Business tonight

children.content: Trading's finished for the day, but as we wait for trades to settle here's what's happening tonight.

image.altText: A man stands looking at a pile of rubble and bricks that has crashed down

items.synopsis: Items set to be used at a young couple's wedding are lost when a tree destroyed their garage as Sydney is hit by a night of wind damage.

title.children: Wild winds lash Sydney, battering homes and blowing off roofs

image.altText: Firefighters in a crane from a fire truck with some on the ground in front of a house

items.synopsis: A postman on his delivery route says he helped pull a woman from a house fire in Adelaide's CBD this morning before she was taken to hospital with minor burns to her hair and face.

title.children: 'Her hair was on fire': Postman on delivery route helps rescue woman from burning house

image.altText: An image from That '70s Show of a man with curly hair and glasses smiling, next to a photo of a man in a courtroom in a suit

items.synopsis: The star of That '70s Show is facing life in prison for raping two women, in a case which has stirred controversy around the church where he and his victims met.

title.children: 'Your sickness is no longer mine to bear': The key moments from Danny Masterson's sentencing

image.altText: Indian Flag and ''Bharat'' Name seen in the mobile phone.

items.synopsis: Speculation is swirling that the world's most populous country could change its name, following in the recent footsteps of Türkiye.

title.children: Is India about to change its name to Bharat?

image.altText: A woman sitting in her seat in the House of Representatives

items.synopsis: North Sydney independent MP Kylea Tink says an opposition member yelled at her aggressively in parliament on Wednesday, but Mr Dutton says he has no concerns with the account he's been given.

title.children: Peter Dutton has 'no concerns' about 'aggressive' behaviour of opposition MP

image.altText: Queen Elizabeth stands smiling and leaning on a cane next to a lit fireplace.

items.synopsis: The plans for her death were meticulous. Her lavish funeral had a code name. But when the kingdom's second Elizabethan era drew to a close, everyone suddenly seemed to be a little caught off-guard.

title.children: The inside story of the Queen's final hours, and how they foretold the first year of Charles's reign

image.altText: Composite image of a woman wearing sunglasses and a scarf, and a man in a cap and mask.

items.synopsis: A regional Victorian couple has been handed two-year community correction sentences and fined $196,000 after being found guilty of illegally selling cats and failing to provide veterinary care.

title.children: Couple who sold sick kittens from car boot hit with $196k in fines and costs for animal cruelty

image.altText: A book page with a colourful scene on the left and grey scene on the right.

items.synopsis: Amanda Lieber noticed how distressed a mother was as she dropped her child at a hospital's school. She comforted her, and the experience led her to write about a parent's depression as seen through a child's eyes.

title.children: Amanda wrote a child's book about a parent with depression. A publisher wanted a happy ending

image.altText: Naomi Bowden

items.synopsis: Through tears Naomi Bowden tells a NSW inquiry into birth trauma how distressing it was to have police take her stillborn daughter and put her in an ice box in front of her.

title.children: Naomi speaks up about the 'disrespectful' treatment she received after her baby was stillborn

image.altText: Kobie Parfitt looks directly at the camera. She has long brown hair and is wearing a black top.

items.synopsis: Shannon Jeffrey, 34, had fatally assaulted Kobie Parfitt, 42, and dumped her body down a mineshaft. The crime went undetected for eight months. Today, she has been sentenced for manslaughter.

title.children: Woman jailed for killing Ballarat mother of four and dumping her body down a mineshaft

image.altText: A man walks along a road with a jacket over his shoulders and head.

items.synopsis: Greece has been slammed by "extraordinary" downpours from a weather pattern shaped like the final letter of the country's alphabet. Here is why this one was so intense.

title.children: Parts of Greece have recorded an entire year's worth of rain in 18 hours, a month after heatwaves and fire. What's caused it?

image.altText: A serious Indigenous man, moustache, beard, brown shirt,  stands in front of tree.

items.synopsis: Antonio Murray, who had a request for an interpreter dismissed during a trial, has had his conviction quashed over what a statewide Aboriginal language service calls a "basic human right".

title.children: Pilbara man has assault conviction overturned after regional magistrate dismissed his interpreter

image.altText: A police officer on the phone looks out over a lake

items.synopsis: Weather conditions force a pause in the search for a Canberra man missing near Adaminaby in the NSW Snowy Mountains.

title.children: Search for missing fisher abandoned for the day after body of companion found at Lake Eucumbene

image.altText: A woman with short blonde hair wearing a gold tracksuit top hands a tall baton to a young girl.

items.synopsis: Commonwealth Games Australia has been accused of a lack of urgency by a senate inquiry as it searches for a new host for the 2026 games.

title.children: Commonwealth Games could be pushed back to 2027 after Victoria's cancellation, senate inquiry hears

image.altText: A man in a white shirt looks into a food delivery bag

items.synopsis: An analysis of data from China's second largest food delivery service shows that adding a "green nudge" could eliminate more than 3 million tonnes of single-use plastic.

title.children: A simple 'green nudge' could save millions of tonnes of plastic waste each year

image.altText: A magnified image of tuberculosis.

items.synopsis: SA Health says 13 people have tested positive for the potentially deadly disease in the Aṉangu Pitjantjatjara Yankunytjatjara (APY) Lands since the outbreak started in March.

title.children: 'Extremely concerning' tuberculosis outbreak in far north South Australia prompts testing blitz

image.altText: A child sits in a front passenger seat using a phone with the seatbelt over their head

items.synopsis: Transport Minister Mark Bailey said the department is seeking "urgent legal advice on the swift re-issuance of incorrectly suspended licences".

title.children: 'This is our mistake': Transport department issues hundreds of 'incorrect' seatbelt penalties

image.altText: A comparison of teeth from three koalas species.

items.synopsis: Scientists say teeth from the species have been found at a 25-million-year-old fossil bed south of Alice Springs. It is the first-ever record of koalas living in the Northern Territory.

title.children: New prehistoric koala named for its thorn-like teeth discovered in Northern Territory

image.altText: Plastic two litres of Coles milk in the dairy cabinet.

items.synopsis: Supermarket giant Coles is pushing to buy two milk factories, but Australian dairy farmers say it will give the retailer too much control over farm gate milk prices.

title.children: Farmers call on ACCC to block Coles milk factory deal amid 'bargaining power' fears

image.altText: Russia's President Vladimir Putin, India's PM Narendra Modi and North Korean leader Kim Jong Un.

items.synopsis: When the G20 began in 2008 against a backdrop of a global economic crisis, nations came together to fix problems both internationally and at home. Fifteen years later, the event is struggling to even get a full list of attendees.

title.children: Demolished slums, new roads, and animal control: India is going all out for the G20, but is it still an effective forum?

image.altText: Cows stand near a water trough.

items.synopsis: NSW farmers who own land with river, lake, and estuary frontage have historically had unlimited access to water for livestock and domestic consumption, but their right to the resource is under review.

title.children: Fears historic rights to livestock water will be restricted as government reviews usage
